feed.title: CSCI340 Blog
feed.subtitle: This is a blog that will be updated for my CSCI340 Web Systems and Databases class.

entry.title: Introduction post
entry.content:
For this lab I’ve had quite a few problems in setting up Jekyll. Using the command prompt brought up a few problems as my documents folder that I wanted to access was the wrong folder that my Gemfile was in. I had some problems getting my server to update my local website whenever I made changes but after updating tzinfo and restarting the server the problem went away. Another problem I had was trying to add links, there are many different ways to do this depending on what kind of link you a referencing, but I got it figured out in the end. I’m looking forward to get the blog to look nice and stylized, I hope that I will have less problems with that.

Some useful links for me:

  • My Github
  • Dr. Goadrich’s Class site
  • Jekyll Guides and Help
entry.summary: For this lab I’ve had quite a few problems in setting up Jekyll. Using the command prompt brought up a few problems as my documents folder that I wanted to access was the wrong folder that my Gemfile was in. I had some problems getting my server to update my local website whenever I made changes but after updating tzinfo and restarting the server the problem went away. Another problem I had was trying to add links, there are many different ways to do this depending on what kind of link you a referencing, but I got it figured out in the end. I’m looking forward to get the blog to look nice and stylized, I hope that I will have less problems with that.
